results.title: Anatomy of a murder
results.brief_description: A riveting courtroom drama of rape and premeditated murder is brought to life with an all-star cast in Otto Preminger’s suspenseful and highly acclaimed production. Packed with drama, passion and intrigue, the film pits humble small-town lawyer, Jimmy Stewart against hard-headed city prosecutor, George C. Scott. Emotions flare as jealous army lieutenant, Ben Gazzara pleads innocent to murdering the rapist of his seductive, beautiful wife, Lee Remick. Honoured with seven Academy Award nominations and featuring a brilliant score by Duke Ellington, this film is a masterpiece that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Based on the novel by Robert Traver.

results.title: Anatomy of a Businessman
results.brief_description: Lunch break at Ibis Traders. Midcalf dozes uneasily inside his locked office. Tilling, suspecting that Midcalf has stolen his jar of sweet onions, seeks a confrontation. A great deal can be learnt about an animal’s habits by examining the contents of its stomach.

results.title: Anatomical models
results.brief_description: A study of the manufacture of anatomical models, and their use in demonstrating the position of various organs, bones and muscles in the body. Suitable for Upper Primary to Upper Secondary students. No other credits available.

results.title: Anastasia (1997) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Fox Family Films (Twentieth Century Fox), Don Bluth and Gary Goldman
results.brief_description: Beginning with her early childhood in 1916 Russia, this $50 million fantasy recreates the story of the lost Russian Princess, Anastasia. Finding herself in an orphanage when the revolution forces her family into exile, Anastasia grows into a young woman called Anya with little memory of her past. Years later while in St Petersburg with her puppy, she meets a handsome man called Dimitri who takes her to Paris to reclaim her status as a Romanov. Anastasia and Dimitri have an instant affinity - having met years before, only neither of them remembers. Their journey to reach Paris and solve one of the greatest mysteries of the twentieth century is impeded by the evil monk Rasputin and his sidekick Bartok the bat. Fortunately there are plenty of lively songs and voice characterisation by prominent Hollywood stars to dispel any frightening outcomes. Voices are provided by Meg Ryan, John Cusack, Kelsey Grammer, Hank Azaria, Christopher Lloyd and Angela Lansbury. Anastasia’s songs are performed by Liz Callaway. Also available on VHS [311896]

results.title: Anastasia
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Buddy Adler and Anatole Litvak
results.brief_description: Classic film from the play by Marcelle Maurette, adapted by Guy Bolton and screenplay by Arthur Laurents. The story is based on a factual account of the mystery that surrounded the Russian princess Anastasia, youngest daughter of Tzar Nicholas II, who along with her family was imprisoned and shot after the 1917 revolution. Or was she shot? Did Anastasia in fact live on? The scene is Paris in 1928 during the time of Russian Easter. A destitute and suicidal woman suffering from amnesia who remarkably resembles Princess Anastasia (Ingrid Bergman) is rescued by exiled Russian General Bounine (Yul Brynner). The suave, but forceful General, conspires to pass this woman off as the long-lost daughter of the Tzar for the sole purpose of benefiting from the Princess’s ten million pound inheritance. But there are many who remain sceptical, not least of all the Russian Grand Duchess (Helen Hayes), grandmother of the real Anastasia. An intriguing plot played out superbly by Bergman and Brynner but also made all the more intriguing following Bergman’s own Hollywood comeback from exile in Europe after her affair with Italian director, Roberto Rossellini. (Awards: Academy Awards, 1957, Ingrid Bergman for Best Actress in a Leading Role; Golden Globes, 1957, Ingrid Bergman for Best Motion Picture Actress - Drama)

results.title: Anansi the spider: a tale from the Ashanti
results.creator_credit: Gerald McDermott Films and Gerald McDermott
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “African folklore”.
Anansi is a folk hero of the Ashanti people of Ghana and is a spider with human qualities. In this tale he falls into a river and is swallowed by a fish. After his rescue another accident befalls him. Rescued again, Anansi wishes to reward his son who has helped him with the aid of a beautiful white globe. Nyame, the One god, resolves the dilemma for him by setting the globe in the sky: it is the moon. Animation by Vincent Bell and narrated by Athmani Magoma. Animation inspired by the sophisticated geometric forms of the Ashanti.

results.title: Ananse's farm
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig and John Ossei
results.brief_description: A fable from Ghana, animated on film by a young African film-maker studying with the National Film Board. Ananse is a spider with a heart full of concern over the enmity existing between his friends. Instead of mediating in a straightforward way, he devises a scheme using a little deception to bring his friends to amicable terms. The moral of this folktale from Ghana is that employing the wrong means to an end brings undesired consequences, no matter how right the motive.

results.title: Analyze this = Analyse this
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Village Roadshow Pictures, Paula Weinstein, Jane Rosenthal and Harold Ramis
results.brief_description: Mob boss Paul Vitti (Robert DeNiro) is having trouble sleeping on the eve of a planned meeting between rival Mafia gangs. His anxiety soon turns into a full blown panic attack prompting the tough guy to contact psychiatrist Ben Sobel (Billy Crystal). The neurotic Sobel initially refuses to take Vitti on as a patient but soon finds that the desperate criminal doesn’t take rejection well. Director Harold Ramis uses this comedic premise effectively, parodying the mobs ‘tough guy’ ethos, while lampooning an assortment of familiar gangster films. The casting of DeNiro is a joke in itself as the actor sends up his previous film incarnations as the quintessential Mafia ‘wiseguy’. Cast also includes Lisa Kudrow, Chazz Palminteri and Joe Viterelli.

results.title: Analytical filtration
results.brief_description: One of a series of instructional films produced to assist science teachers to demonstrate laboratory techniques to large groups of students. The film covers, in complete detail, the various operations involved in the simple technique of analytical filtration.

results.title: Analysis of Agility Exercises
results.brief_description: Film based on the Board of Education Syllabus of Physical Training for Schools (1933). Children in the film were drawn from city and borough elementary school. Various physical training exercises are demonstrated including crouch jumps, cat springs, broad jumps, hop, step, and jump forward, backward rolls and cartwheels.
